title: Riot Games reminds me of that guy....
body:
Who made an amazing drawing
Which he kept admiring
Asking himself if it was really him who made it?
But he tried to add somethings more
Which only ruined it. He tried to correct it
But it wasn't as good as before.

replies.body:
You didn't finish. You only got to about mid to late season 4 in the timeline.

You forgot about the parts where he decided it _was_ better now, ignoring everything wrong with it and continuing to add more, being so proud of his work that he convinced himself that any previous iteration was just nostalgia, which according to him, is the enemy of "progress." And no matter how many of his friends watching him do this told him to stop, as long as it looked fine to him, it was perfect, so he talked down to them for not recognizing his genius.
I mean, But a lot of looking back at the old seasons is nostalgia. this game has been shit for a long time.

I'm using it as an example by painting it as something bad - which is cases such as this, it's perfectly fine to have fond memories of the past since back then, it was still fun to play. 

 I'm looking at League now the same way I look at WoW; Blizzard doesn't like thinking in the past and the game has gone to shit, and while ignoring the playerbase, they're insisting that we don't want to go back either.  It's funny, I've been on vanilla servers for quite a while and I'm not bored...hmm, I guess it _must_ have been something that happened to the game to make me hate it, but what do I know?  I don't want the old content - I think I do, but I don't, right Blizzard?  Right Riot?

You realize if they didn't change people would stop playing anyways. Regardless if WoW added some things or not people stopped playing. At least with their expansions players come back, even if its only for a short time. You act like videos games not changing at all makes them stay popular. I agree not everything that has been added has been good but honestly if they just sat around doing nothing then people would stop playing anyways. I have played since season 1 and fine with the changes that have been made. I don't think all the changes are perfect but happy Riot at least focusing on improving the game rather than just sitting around doing nothing. They have taken some risks even when advised not to and it has back fired. That have sort of apologized, although not fully. 

Like what do you people who say "this game is shit but its always been shit" or "we want to go back to the old game" ever actually think about what this would do. LIke Riot just decides.. fuck it going back to patch 4.12. You know how much this game would change? Back to dragons being boring as shit. Back to missing a lot of new champions. Back to boring old masteries. Back to many updates being thrown out the window. Like yea not all changes they have made are great and their is still patching that needs to be done. But this game would be so dull and boring if it was now where it was 2 years ago. 

Like would people have really kept playing WoW if they just never added expansions? I assume players more complaining about different aspects of the game they added like dungeon finder or w/e people complain about in WoW. Maybe they should have listened, but to the casual player those different aspects they added made the game easier to pickup and play. Veterans going to cry about it but eventually they quit and Blizzard or Riot needs new revenue from somewhere. So they make changes to get new players interested. Whether WoW changed or not doesn't matter to me as I have played every expansion and get sick of it after a couple weeks. So you can complain about Riot all you want and that is fine, but realize not everyone shares your opinion. 

Whether you agree or not whatever Riot is doing has kept this game extremely popular. So by default I would say they are doing just fine until proven otherwise.

>Like what do you people who say "this game is shit but its always been shit" or "we want to go back to the old game" ever actually think about what this would do. LIke Riot just decides.. fuck it going back to patch 4.12. You know how much this game would change? Back to dragons being boring as shit. Back to missing a lot of new champions. Back to boring old masteries. Back to many updates being thrown out the window. Like yea not all changes they have made are great and their is still patching that needs to be done. But this game would be so dull and boring if it was now where it was 2 years ago.

As boring as you make it out to be, it's when I personally had the most fun with League.

Fun happens before but not as strongly now, because that is how evolution works.

Did you have fun with any other games? Oblivion .. maybe, Mario Kart? .. help me out here.

Now, you could put those games in now, and try to recapture that feeling. It would be the identical game .. and yet, you would find yourself bored. How can it be, if it is the game that holds the key to happiness and joy?

The reason why it is not fun anymore, even though it was fun back then, and even though it is the identical experience, is because you changed in that time, and you aren't the identical person anymore. You've had experiences, changed, grown, and evolved.

It always happens to everyone, and so nostalgia only exists to give us a few moments of fondness over what happened in the past; yet we cannot go back into the past to relive what was already lived.
Exactly.

Yup.

But there is good news too.

The good news is, we can still make a _new_ feeling of joy and excitement. But to do it, we have to avoid trying to produce the exact same experience as the one in the past .. and just let the experience in the present delight us.

I could share a little story to illustrate what I mean. Would anybody like me to?

DotA 2 hasn't changed in 4 years. 

Its now MORE fun than League.

GG. 

You know there something wrong when a game's main competitor does nothing to change their game and raises in popularity while the other sinks while constantly making changes. Open up your eyes. Seriously. 

You want proof? Look at DotA's tournies and such. More and more (this is almost an understatement) people are starting to watch them while fewer and fewer watch League's. 

So much for "new feeling of joy and excitement" from League's changes.

Amen, I play League but I don't watch any League tourneys, you've seen one match you've seen them all nowadays.

I don't play Dota2 but I find it's tourneys to be far more exciting, far less predictable and alot more enjoyable to watch, than those of Leauge.
Ok I offered, but you rejected my offer.
You can share your story, but I don't see how a personal experience will change what Riot is doing.
Well, no I can't anymore. Sadly you'd trample on it and destroy it, and I don't have so many personal experiences that I can afford to give them up to people who are dead set in their ways

Sure, Dota2 totally doesn't have patches. *Ahem-acough-watshooo*

The reason why Dota can have patches every 2 months (or was it 6 months?) is because the game is exponentially harder to master than LoL. Any player constantly has massive room to improve themselves. In LoL on the other hand, the most noticeable mechanics are fairly easily mastered. 

When your only objective is to improve as a player and not as a team, that would get boring ridiculously quickly.

Meanwhile I still have fun with a game like TERA, which I've been playing for just barely less time than League. 

I hate the new classes, along with everyone else that played before them. All of the new dungeons are less creative than the originals, and the bosses are all easier and hold generally similar mechanics. And I'm still not bored with that game. Especially the PvP, which has hardly changed at all.  

Yes, there are things I don't like about their changes, but I don't feel pushed away from the game like I do with League now. **League is moving in a negative direction.** Its not just nostalgia speaking. They have made objectively bad decisions for the game and continue to move forward with them, even after admitting they were mistakes at times. 

_____

In short, your argument is insanely flawed.
Not everybody changes or grows
Actually, you might just be really good at forgiving the little things with that game TERA

which is awesome. So, keep on enjoying it right? But now, you gave a completely anecdotal experience, and here's mine: I started playing LoL in late 2015, and I have immense fun with it now and then. For me, the biggest obstacle to that, is people SAYING how I shouldn't be having fun. Other than that, I have a blast

Edit: Oh also people who have become "giver-upers" - who live in a perpetual state of misery and who constantly try to drag me down to their level. But again, when I succeed in overcoming those sad miserable folks ... the game itself? I have a lot of fun with it

The game used to be a LOT better. Late 2015 to now was the worst period in the game.

Nobody said you can't have fun, but the game is objectively, and significantly, worse than its been in at any other point in its history.

it might be possible that youre just tired of the game...I have played final fantasy 7 about 13 times through with months in between...but every time it loses a little shine. you probably have been playing league mostly nonstop for more than a year...it could just be a tired old record for you.

its both the benefit and the downside to never making a League of legends 2...small changes over time can go unappreciated and it feels like the same game for extended periods until it isnt...then you are either happy or sad when the changes hit you.

If it was a league 2 you may have had a different mindset...its not 100% but the psychology factor remains.

I'll use the WoW example again.  I started in early 2005, went all the way through Wrath having a blast with a few nitpicky issues with the additions and especially the class balance later on, but overall it was great.  Since 2011 I had been playing off and on, not enjoying  it anywhere close to how much I did earlier, with every expansion making me dislike WoW more than the last before I stopped completely and haven't played retail since mid-Draenor in 2015.  

Earlier, I mentioned how I'm still playing on vanilla servers and not getting bored with them.  This is a game I've spent over 11 years playing, but I still find the past versions enjoyable.  And why is that?  Because it wasn't a case of boredom, it was a case of hatred with developers' idiotic direction with the game.  I see these arguments like getting bored with Mario Kart or Elder Scrolls, and then you brought up FF7, but here's the thing - those are single player games.  In an online PVP environment, it doesn't get old for me because every game feels different.  If I wanted to raid for whatever reason in WoW, of course I'd get bored because I'm doing the same monotonous thing over and over again, but the competitive environment fighting with and against other people has never gotten old.

Edit: Also for the record I started around or a bit after Draven's release.
if its not fun any more, why keep playing?

I'm not.  I'm waiting for the day League looks fun to play again, because for how much I despised the season 6 changes, I gave it a chance and tried to have fun and all it did was piss me off every time I logged in, just like Cataclysm.  I'm keeping up with the patches, builds, the meta, strong picks, new team comps, etc. so if/when Riot stops snorting crack before they design/balance, I can jump back into it without having a sense of "future shock."
i see.

Ultimately, you can critique art but if the artist wants to improve upon it, much to your dismay, you don't have a say in that matter. It's his art, not yours. If you want art that appeals to you, become an artist yourself and do your own thing.

Except this is a business.

Using the artist analogy, this is closer to a commission. You do what the customer wants, but you are allowed to put your own touch on it.

Under your argument, then all SJW and feminists alike like Anita can dictate what they want to see in a game and pose as customers. And i'd like to avoid that reality.

You don't have the power to demand a change and see it, you only have the power to argue in favor or against changes. Ultimately, it's Riot's decision to make/don't make changes according to their design values. If they don't align with ours, then they're going to make a change how they want or they'll hold off for a while until they manage to find a way to appeal to most people as possible.

That's the beauty of Boards though, where Riot can look up who we are and see how much of a background we have with champions and the game in general, and see how faithful people are to their mains or favorites. It also helps with things like the direction of a rework where they can look up two arguing sides to see one is headed by someone who started in season 6 and picked them up, and the other from season 1 who has mained said champion throughout the seasons, and ideally, they'd be more apt to listen to the more experienced player.  The same can be said about art direction. The longer someone has spent with something, the more attached they get, and that should be taken into consideration.

Except you don't have to pay to play League of Legends.  It's more like an artist allowing you to show his most recent piece in your home.  It keeps getting replaced when he makes a new piece, so even if you liked the old one more, it's not up to you to decide.  They're still owned by the artist.

I don't even know who to compare you to, you're so far gone. You'd be like the person who has visited multiple art galleries and insists the first one was was the best one? And when the newer galleries tried to cater to you, you didn't thank them or think to mention what they did for you? Urgh, it's tough.

(The only thing Riot has opposed is a farmbased playstyle. If you like that that much, go write a post about why that's the best way to play the game. Otherwise, they consistently listen to every complaint on these goshforsaken forums. Eventually. They can't change the game too drastically outside of preseason.)
https://cdn.meme.am/instances/58371294.jpg

I honestly hate this line of thinking because it either ignores the good things that have changed or just downplays them as "Well that was ok BUT..."

We got an entire map update that made SR not look like a PS1 game.
We got crafting that actually gives a ton of free shit for...well, free.
We have a client update by the end of the year after years of waiting.
Champions are boundlessly complex in kit, aesthetic and overall work compared to years ago.
Champion reworks actually solve problems rather than just shifting the problem.

Is League perfect? Of course not. But there is a ton of good Riot -has- done that people conveniently ignore and only lament about "ugh I miss the old days"

That... was.. deep 
{{sticker:zombie-nunu-tears}}
http://i3.kym-cdn.com/entries/icons/original/000/011/187/Naamloos-1.png

This game has definitely gotten better over time. You ever seen old twitch/youtube clips before the visual update? I don't think players realize what they asking for when they talk about prior seasons. Every season there is something broken. Dragons are worth fighting for now, there is a rift herald that can be taken, masteries that make you feel like changing them actually matter, tons of new champions and reworks, jungle changes, support changes. Like yea... its not perfect but shit is def better now than it used to be. People get so hung up on good memories they forget all the old things they used to qq about.

If Riot patched the game back to say season 4 or season 5 (ok yes solo/duo queue would be sweet) people would be sad. I know I would be bored as fuck like... yea I might not play all the new champions but the game would seem so dull. Some people strive better in certain metas I get that but honestly I can't remember any season worth going back to. I don't agree with all of the changes but the game still feels fresh to me. If nothing ever changed what would be the point of continuing to play?

>Dragons are worth fighting for now

Dragons were also worth fighting for before the buff mechanic was introduced and it gave global gold.  

>there is a rift herald that can be taken

Yay?  

>masteries that make you feel like changing them actually matter

Of course they matter because they've warped the entire game's balance around their existence adding insane free power to champions who were already strong without ridiculous masteries pushing them way over the top.  Keystones ruined any hope that League can be balanced and need to be removed as soon as possible, or as soon as Riot collectively pulls their swollen heads out of their asses.

>tons of new champions and reworks

A lot of which weren't asked for, weren't wanted, and/or brought all manner of toxic mechanics to the game, which are VERY SLOWLY being addressed...which is a step in this process that shouldn't have to be needed.

>jungle changes

You were around when the jungle changed the first time, and I don't understand why you'd defend it because that was fucking atrocious - there were champions who could hardly make it through the first clear if at all.  Unless you're talking about the more gold and XP change, then I can't agree to this.


>support changes

Yeah supports actually had good changes, I can't argue that. The only thing I can argue is frost queen's being available for mids for so long without Riot understanding why they were taking it.


> Like yea... its not perfect but shit is def better now than it used to be. People get so hung up on good memories they forget all the old things they used to qq about.

_Highly_ disagree.  And guess what? A great deal of those things we "qq'ed" about are still a problem, but compared to the bullshit we have in front of us now, it doesn't seem that bad.  If you put a turd next to a smellier turd, does the first one stop smelling, or is the other one just that much more noticeable? 

>If Riot patched the game back to say season 4 or season 5 (ok yes solo/duo queue would be sweet) people would be sad.

Again, I disagree, but it's not like it should stay there.  My ideal fantasy is Riot reverting back to the very start of season 4 and asking themselves "what went wrong from here" and re-designing the following season with new information in mind.  I know it won't happen, but I like to dream.

I also wish season 4 would come back. I loved trailblazer smite giving so much jungle diversity and not having so many bullshit items like {{item:3147}} and {{item:3124}}, not to mention that we didn't have to deal with ADC's getting CDR for 4 months before mages could have some too.

Dragons were always worth taking, just because they are now mandatory doesn't mean dragons were never worth taking, they added 1500 to any team who took one, which was pretty large, but didn't give ridiculous buffs that would help the game become even more ridiculously snowbally and add gaps that can never be reduced or countered regardless of strategy.

Keystone masteries are overbearing and the reason tank-assassins and instadelete 0 management/strategy playstyle is a thing.

What you call freshness I call spazzyness, I couldn't give a damn about new champion release as I know they almost always add more overbearing garbage to the game.

Most major sports in the world have barely changed over the last decades, have people lost interest in them? Why muck up something when you already manage to bring it close to a state of greatness, just for the sake of "freshness". Bah.

Basically this. 

People would not have stopped playing League even if they left it at season 1, as far as direction, for 5 years. Obviously champion adjustments would still be made. 

Hell, I definitely wouldn't mind it. I saw more champions then than I do now with double the roster size.

Dragons were always worth taking but no one ever took them. One team would just flock there take it, always know the timer and keep taking it. I guess not you can actually see/feel the impact of taking dragons instead of gold. Riot wanted to make taking dragons different than just taking towers. Def a +. Buffs only ridiculous when you get 2-3 of the same. If your team gets 5 dragons you deserve to have a nice advantage. Gold wears off overtime but dragon buffs stick with a team even in long games. Old dragons were crap just admit it. 

Keystones are too strong no doubt, but acting like the game is ruined by them is ridiculous. 

lol so.... don't mess with anything and the game is solid gotcha. lol people complain so much on here its crazy. It doesn't matter what season the game is in everyone just going to qq about something. 

lmfao sports have also been around for much longer and still tweak rules all the time. Plus this is a video game, its a little different. I am sure if league was out for a hundred years changes that were made would be minor. 

Since Riot doesn't exactly release the numbers it hard to say exactly how the game's popularity has changed over time. Its all speculation really. Yes, Riot has made some dumbass changes. But in the end the game is still the same game. It might take some time to adjust to the changes but you would still recognize the core of the game no matter how much time you take off playing it. 

{{champion:44}} rework was a blessing. His old kit was boring as shit.{{champion:14}} before rework was beyond retarded. Some of the major reworks weren't the best cough {{champion:82}}, but some of the minor one's worked out pretty well {{champion:42}} {{champion:51}}. {{champion:78}} rework was well... interesting.  

Thank god they finally got rid of sated devourer. That was a terrible addition.

Riot's fixed things that needed fixing, according to the community, then completely and totally fucked up things that were perfectly fine, against the will of the community, essentially degrading the quality of the game. 

Take off the rose-tinted glasses yourself. Riot has made more significant mistakes than significant improvements at this point. 

In what way would the game be more boring if it was similar to season 4 or 5? The game was at one of its most stable states during seasons 4 and 5: before Riot decided they knew what we wanted better than we do. 

Seriously, what would make it dull? What has season 6 brought that makes this game more fun, since you seem to be implying it was nothing but improvement? Absolutely nothing. All they've done, not even counting the shit-fest that is Dynamic Queue, is completely fuck up matchmaking for everyone, including normals, and completely fuck up balance with keystones. Way stronger offensive masteries with obscenely weaker defensive masteries doesn't help either.

Suuuure. Because it's not like the whiners fade out of existence when Riot listens to them and then new people start whining because they didn't like the changes. It's totally not like that.

I totally didn't find the "farm to win" playstyle of S5 boring as all get out but I'm sure most people like playing this game half asleep. I was undoubtedly in the minority there. *Yeeep.*

S4 was the season of assassins and late game hypercarries. Look in the mirror. That is what denial looks like.
